column2: JessieBS, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on this pill when I was 19yo for help with cramping.  I started taking it September, by May I had had stroke.  I would not recommend this medication for anyone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Ortho Tri-Cyclen about a year and half ago. For the first 6 months everything was great. After the 6 months I started noticing a change in my personality. I have always been some what sensitive, however this intensified those feelings. I cry over everything and anything. If something makes me extremely happy, I cry. If something makes me sad (but not I would not normally cry over) I cry. I feel as if it really just intensifies my mood x1000. I have also had problems with re-occuring yeast infections. I get one about every 6 weeks. I did not gain any weight at all. I had moderate amount pimples before...now I usually only get them around my period. I have just recently switched pills to see if there is any difference but I am currently having trouble with high copays. I honestly think that no BC is good for you, you just need to pick and choose which side effects you are willing to deal with.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started using Ortho Tri-Cyclen for acne 2 months ago. So far it hasn't helped my acne at all-I think it may actually be worse. I have had some spotting in between periods, but I think that's normal when starting new birth control. I have been somewhat more emotional and depressed but its usually right before my period. I haven't noticed any extreme side effects but it just seems like its not helping acne! I'm going stay on for a few more months to see if it helps then.

column2: Manning60H, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Lutera for 5 years. Absolutely loved it. I never had any negative side effects (no weight gain, mood swings, baby-free, etc.) I have recently been under a lot of stress and developed some mild to moderate acne. Of course, I wanted that to go away so when my annual gyno appt. came up I asked about different birth controls that would help with acne. My gyno suggested Ortho Tri-Cyclen (I got the generic form called Trinessa). This is my first and last month on this pill. I cannot deal with the negative side effects. I was sick to my stomach the first week. I've also had terrible mood swings the entire month (crying at the drop of a hat, freaking out over little things, depressed) and NO sex drive whatsoever, which is not like me. It's starting to put a strain on my relationship so I called my doctor and switched back to my Lutera. I'm sure my acne will clear up on its own since it's due to stress. To me the side effects aren't worth it. I've talked to three different women that had similar experiences on Ortho Tri-Cyclen and now I'm reading a lot of reviews of the drug that say the same things.

column2: CashierGirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Ive been taking this drug since 2008, its been very good. No issues :) Only thing that is a down fall is its $79 for me... :(( Periods are short, acne is low.

column2: rouge17, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on ortho tri-cyclen for about 5 years. Never really had any major side effects. The one I didn't like was the weight gain. Nothing I did took it off. I recently changed doctors and even though I have never have a problem with ortho she said she has never been a fan of the tri-phasic pills so she has switched me over to junel fe 1/30... hopefully it works out just as well as ortho did! IF not i will definitely request to switch back! Wish me luck! One thing I would like women reading these reviews to remember is everyone's body is different which means everyone is going to react differently to different pills. There's always risk involved with birth control. If you are using this to decide what pill is best for you, don't freak out about negative reviews.. your body will review it for you. If one doesn't make you happy, talk to your doctor. Thats what they are for.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on this pill for a long time now, and I am so relieved to read these comments; I'm not alone. The week before my period is intense; I cry constantly, I become distant, a shut-in, extremely depressed. That is not my personality...my boyfriend can always tell when it's the week before my period. I'm definately talking to my doctor to switch.

column2: 1990, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This was the very first oral form of birth control I've ever taken. I had been on it for over two years and the first year and a half I experienced no negative side effects other than mild weight gain, 5 pounds. Then the remaining six months I noticed a change in my attitude. All of the sudden I'm beyond sensitive, I cry at commericals that aren't even sad. I find myself on the cycle of pills the week before I start my period to be at an all time low. I get depressed and violent. I find any excuse to fight with anyone unfortunate enough to be in my company. EVERYTHING hurts my feelings. I'm typically I very passive person with a very outgoing attitude and all of the sudden I  become Mr Hyde and lose control of myself. Take with caution.

column2: Becky18, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am now 21 and I started taking these pills since I was 16. These pills have been very effective in preventing pregnancy for me. I have gone off the pill a couple of times and have noticed the difference in my body good and bad.The pros while taking it for me have been: Not getting pregnant and having fuller breasts.The cons: I get moody easily, angry easily, it lowers my sex drive, and I'm more emotional.I have come to realize that it is time for me to switch to a non-hormonal pill because ortho tri-cyclen is just not working out anymore and not worth it with all the bad side effects.

column2: MariahA&lt;3, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I HATE IT! I am fifteen year old and I have been taking the pill for about a month now. The day I began taking it, I had problem leeping. I began my period the next week and have been on it for three week now. I have about fainted from how much ive bled. I havent been able to get rid of my weight, the pill had me at a locked in weight. I hae tried droppig the weight but I couldn't. The cramp were killing me and mood hit rock bottom. DO NOT TAKE THE PILL!!

column2: chrys, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Took this pill for 2 yrs and it worked wonderfully until the beginning of the second year. I started developing symptoms of depression which I thought were just winter blues. I then started to become severely depressed and sought therapy. After a couple sessions my therapist recommended me discussing changing my pill with my GYN. Almost immediately after the switch (about 3 days) I noticed I was back to being "me". This pill was fantastic for the first 1 1/2yrs and the only side effects I had were bigger breasts( a pro as far as I am concerned). However when the depression happened I didn't even think to attribute it to my pill. I was having suicidal thoughts and became shut off to everyone. I almost started taking anti depressants when I decided to try switching my BC first. I am now on a monophasic pill (only into the 3rd month) and so far so goo.

column2: Jen, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went on Ortho Tri-cyclen in the hopes that it would treat my moderate acne but after my 3rd pack, it has done little if nothing to clear up my skin. I might just need to be patient and give the drug more time to decrease my body's androgens, but I'm going to switch to a different BC because of the severity of my symptoms. The first month and a half was fine for me but after that I started noticing that I was becoming more and more socially anxious and depressed. I feel "out of it" most of the time now and last week I was crying for no reason. I do have a predisposition to depression but I was shocked at how much this pill has negatively affected my mood. Pros: weight gain (I am very thin and have always tried to gain weight), larger breasts & no babiesCons: feeling zombiefied, anxious, weepy and overall depressed mood, feeling fatigued, and occasionally feeling nauseous

column2: HoNey.., 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i recently went to the clinic and i did not have very much money to get other birth controls so dey prescribed me this medicine  and i'm hella concerned about wat thangs i put inside my body anywhyz so after i read sum of these reviews i change my mind and i aint gonna take dis shit..

column2: ash00, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this birth control for 2 months. It has done the job of not getting me pregnant, but the side effects aren't worth it. Since I started taking the birth control I started getting more headaches, had upset stomach a lot, always feel bloated, depressed, and very moody.

column2: HealthSavvy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: When I was 19 I started this drug for birth control. I did not know at the time it would be a miracle pill for my extreme painful periods, which is the reason I take it now. I have always taken the brand name with the exception of trying generic as a trial, TriSprintec. I started to develop melasma on my perfect skin. I know only the compound ingredients are different. I do not know if the generic was to blame or moving to an area where the sun is stronger. Perhaps the sun rays caused increased sensitivity. I went back to brand name. For me this drug has been wonderful and the doctor said if it works well stay with it. If anyone else has had a similar experience with trying generic, please share.

column2: bc, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: When I first started this medication I had horrible headaches and very heavy periods.  My doctor said to take two alieve everyday to get rid of the headaches.  This did work, but then I started having terrible stomach pains and didn't want to eat.  I called the doctor again and she said to give it a month before I decide to switch to a different pill.  It's been one week and I feel sick all the time.  I still take the pill and now I'm beginning to feel very depressed and I'm not on my period.  I'm calling the doctor again tomorrow to see if she'll switch me to a low hormone pill.  This just isn't the right medication for me, esspecially with the side effects I've experienced just within the first week.  I understand it takes your body time to adjust-- but having headaches, not eating, and feeling depressed is just too overwhelming for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began using this drug when i was 14 years old. I was having very long and strong/heavy and EXTREMLY painful period cycles. I was only on it for 2 years but I believe the damage was already done. Now I'm 25 I am divorced with no kids (due to the endometriosis) and my pain is worse EVERY NEW PERIOD! Some one needs to compensate US WOMEN for this!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Do not take this drug! I only took it for two days and began to experience a variety of extreme side effects. Including: insomnia, severe depression, anxiety, abdominal pain, irritability,and nausea.There are other hormonal birth control pills that are just as effective with out the horrible side effects!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I seemed fine at first but after about 6-7 months of taking trinessa, I developed horrible side effects. I would have hot flashes, painful cysts under arms near breast, unwanted hair, mood swings, headaches, nausea, etc. I've never had this type of problem with any of birth control. It did seem to clear up my face, but def not worth it with the horrible symptoms I had because of it. I start a new pill Monday and am hoping this clears all my symptoms up. I'm posting this to maybe help someone who has had similar side effects. This pill might work for a lot of people but def not for me...and it took me a long time to figure out what was wrong with me!(Now off to stand outside in the cold because Im having another hotflash!)

Also, I am a very reasonable and logical person and since taking this pill my emotions have been all kinds of messed up. If you like feeling paranoid and crazy, this is the drug for you.

column2: MKmom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started taking the generic form of this drug, and within three weeks I became severely depressed and anxious. I also experienced stomach upset and diarrhea. I would not recommend this drug.

column2: mfg, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: IAgirl27, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking this medication with triple therapy for Hep C. It is easy to use and causes no additional side effects with the Hep C meds or paxil. I love it =)

column2: heather5263, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This birth control was great -- until it made me gain weight. It took care of my long/heavy periods and my acne disappeared while I was on this pill. The weight gain occured suddenly and I've gained approx. 30 pounds. This pill has also made my blood  pressure very high.

column2: Icare, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was on Ortho Tri-Cyclen for over 10 years.  It was great until I hit 35.  When I was younger, it did exactly what it should: prevented contraception, kept my skin clear :), and did not affect my sex drive.  At 35, I assume that my body changed and this drug affected me HORRIBLY.  The minor effect was high blood pressure, which was strange, since I'm very athletic and careful about what I eat.  The worst symptom was depression - SEVERE depression - suicidal depression.  It took months to figure it out, and when I started testing:  I could literally feel my mood sink 15 minutes after taking the pill.  I would not write this drug off, since it worked so reliably for years.  Just be aware and share the information that the side effects can be SERIOUS to some people.

column2: Mango446, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication started off great. It helped with my skin, too, and no weight gain. However, I had almost no sex drive and developed inflammation (caused by the medication-everything else has been ruled out) "down there" so horrible that it was impossible to have sex. I'm stopping immediately and praying it goes away. I'm very disappointed.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just now started taking it. Once i take the pill, within an hour or so i start feeling really weird and my stomach kinda hurts, other than that no other side effects!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking it for a week now and I have been feeling sick to my stomach the whole time.

column2: Nikki1978, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for a very long time. I have tried some generic forms and seemed to be on very long periods when I switched. I just continue on the name brand. Its great for acne and birthcontrol in general. I did try two other kinds of pills where you arent supposed to get your period..UH NO THANKS! Those made me crazy and depressed big time. Give this one a chance for a few months. its the best in my opinion, I just wish insurance would cover it more.

column2: n/a, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on try-cyclen for a year. I actually lost weight when I went on it (about 30lbs over 6 months) but I unfortunately got super super irritable. It just kept getting worse, and worse and worse. I developed anxiety and depression, and went through a bit of a personal identity crisis. There was something wrong with me, and I hadn't even considered the pill as being the cause, which thus left me questioning myself a tonne. Why couldn't I figure out what was causing my feelings? Finally, when talking to a friend about my feelings, she said, maybe it's the birth control? Sure enough, after about a month of being off of it, I was 100% back to my normal self. Unfortunately, my normal self also meant re-gaining about half the weight I lost when I went on it. Would never take it again, it messed with me mentally wayyy too much.

column2: Pila48, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for 3 years. I purchased it from planned parenthood, they were constanly rude and unfriendly when I went in so I decided to go through my insurance. My insurance didn't pay much for Ortho-Tri so I was left paying $72. I decided I'd switch to the generic Tri-Sprintec which made me so sick and moody. After 2 months I switched back to my beloved Ortho-Try-Cyclen. I've decided to try for less periods so I'm starting Ortho-Cyclen. It's made by the same manufaturer and has the same blue pills I was taking in Ortho-Try. So far so good.

column2: K.Gwinn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Dr. switched me from trivora to this pill, because of my hormones. I have night sweats at night too, and just don't seem interested in sex too much.  I started bleeding the day I started and have not stoppped yet. Although it is a light period, I am not liking it at all. My Dr. told me to wait 3 months to let the pill get in my system. But I just wonder if it would be better for my hubby to get fixed and I can stop taking these and go back to normal.....

column2: bld991204, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: sarahlove2000, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for about 2 months and so far it's been great. Short periods with no cramping and no weight gain.But I have had the worst unbelievable nausea I am beggining to wonder if may I am pregnant.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on birthcontrol for 4 years. Last year I had been on the generic version of this drug which worked perfectly good. However the periods were not light at all. I have just recently switched to the name brand because of my insurance.I use to have bad acne but since ive been on this pill it has helped drasticly. However my face broke out pretty bad within the first 2 weeks of use,  i recall the same results when I first started th generic brand. The acne eventually clears up and stays that way. I have always had my period on same day, every sunday, every 28 days. Its amazing. However with the start of the name brand I have noticed intense mood swings and the pill case is unattractive and very odd.

column2: ThisPillSucks, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had been on various birth control pills for about 9 years before I became pregnant while using Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo (and with perfect use, too). I stopped taking the pill for a year, but I have suffered from ovarian cysts in the past and a particularly large and painful cyst that burst led my gyno to prescribe the pill once again. Ortho Tri Cyclen was my gyno's recommendation since, other than becoming pregnant, I was very happy wih OTC Lo in terms of side effects. However, OTC does not seem to be a good pill choice, after all. While waiting to start OTC, the first day of my period happened to be a Sunday, so I started my first pack on that day. Not only did it make my period heavier and last longer, I had breakthrough bleeding once I began the third week of active pills. In a few more days I begin the week of inactive/"reminder" pills, which means I will start my period. 3 weeks of bleeding in one month?! No, thank you! Furthermore, this pill makes me crave carbohydrates like no other pill I have ever taken. It's ridiculous. I was expecting this to some degree, but I wasn't prepared for such an abrupt and noticeable change in appetite. I have not gained weight because I have consciously altered my diet and increased my physical activity, but who wants to crave sweets all the time?! Not me. I will switch to a new pill ASAP, or, better yet, not take any hormonal birth control at all. These side effects interfere with my life much more than ovarian cysts!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

I am going to have to change, my breasts have been tender for the the full 4 months, very irratable, depressed, low self esteem, moody, crabby, etc.  I have gained 10 lbs, makes me hungry all the time.  The only benefit is the birth control and lighter periods.  I am going to have to switch to something as this is making me a completly differnt person.  I wish it could have worked for me as it has for so many others.  :(

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: very satisfied with the results, have not had any major side effects.

column2: jso716, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this pill for 11 years and have never had a problem with it. My periods are light, my skin has cleared up, and I don't have any pms or mood swings. I think it works great.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: In 2000 in my early 30s, I was switching from Depo Provera to Ortho Tricyclen under the care of a very experienced ob/gyn team after having my two children when I was stricken with DVT that I shouldn't have survived except for the care of my internist and a vascular surgeon who simply would not give up on me despite all the initial bad decisions of the emergency care team. On the Depo, I had weight gain and was having to drive monthly to another town to have my heart checked as a recommended precaution while on the Depo, though I had no prior history. All users of either of these meds should proceed with extreme caution. I belive the medical field needs to begin more rigorous routine testing for blood clotting factors in BC takers. That incident created lots of long term complications, a lifetime on blood thinners, and I was no longer able to have children in the prime of my life. I had always hoped for one, maybe two more.

column2: Mbouchard82, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

I have a five year old son, when I decided I wanted to concieve I simply stopped taking my pills and within 6 months I became pregnant and had a perfectly to the book pregnancy.  After giving birth and breast-feeding for a year, I went right back on my pill.  I love this product, I trust it, and I will never switch or use generics!

I had no problems for many years, but now I have to switch to mircette to try to correct all those side effects, but overall was very satisfied.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have used this medication for 8+ years.  Never experienced any negative side effects or probelms.  Shorter, predictable periods, clear skin, zero weight gain.  I only take the brand name, as I don't trust generics, and have always taken this right before bedtime (when I first started on OC, advice I was given was to take at bedtime would help you avoid experiencing any unpleasant nausea symptoms)

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I love it so far and it's my 2 day of using it!I feel like it puts my mind at ease, periods can be regular possibly i have to wait for another month lol but I think anyone should give it a try but maintain their own personality and understand it is a pill that u take everyday but it is not going to control mood swing if u already are moody which a lot women get just like any ordinary person and u can choose to eat more or less it is your choice and has nothing to do with a pill.Thanks and Good luck to anyone willing to give it a try!

column2: Cawtnay, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My periods are almost nonexistent now! My mood swings have lessened, and I am very regular. I barely ever cramp now, and when I do, it isn't painful enough to take medication.

I was on the generic version of Ortho for a while.  I was getting two periods a month on that pill so my doctor switched me to the regular version.  I have had the WORST mood swings ever and I don't know how my fiance has put up with me.  I just called to get changed back to the generic.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: have taken it for years and have had no problems, side effects from this pill.  Love it it works great.

column2: RachelS, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am on the generic version of Ortho-Tricyclen and I have had no major problems. The very first month I was on it I was hungry all the time-- it felt like the week before my period the whole month. After that, I have had no problems. The only time I have ever had any breakthrough bleeding or mood swings was when I skipped the in-active pills to skip my period that month. I had breakthrough bleeding and my hormones were all over the place so I am never doing that again. Other than that, it has been great.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
ttakd, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 33 and have been taking Ortho for about 4 years now. I am right on track with my periods, I know when I am going to be on it, it always lasts for exactly 5 days, and I only cramp a little about a week before my period. The only thing I have a problem with is taking it at the same time everyday. I got a pill box to help with the doses and it seemed to help a little. I thought that I might try just getting one of the IUD's, but when I read about the hair loss associated with them, I realized that taking a pill everyday just isn't so bad..lol.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on bc's since i had my daughter 3 years ago and i would have cycles every 3 to 6mos.First micronor, on top of post partum depression it had me almost suicidal. ortho lo had the worst mood changes ever(flew off the handle with my boss and started crying for NO apparent reason)!  now ortho tri. had not been so bad,except i never remember my pill and the way i remember it is after I have moodswing, massive migraines for hours or i just have no appetite until it is time for time for the next pill, even though i have a pretty healthy appetite. Major PLUS, sex drive is ridiculously high and my boyfriend complains! lol. Only time it is normal is when my cycle comes and even then it isn't completely suppressed.For the sake of staying additional kid free, thinking about the ring so i won't forget but then again i really don't know what that could do to my hormone fragile body! Wish me luck!

column2: Unsatisfied Patient, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It works well, but I had horrible side effects. I already suffer from depression, but my symptoms got much worse after a few weeks of being on the pill - which  sucks because I just started my first semester of college. I had pretty serious breakthrough bleeding for the first month or two, and my skin has started to break out- I haven't had acne in two or three years. I've also gained about 15 pounds that I cannot for the life of me seem to lose. I'm done with OTC. It definitely wasn't worth the side effects!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I switched from Depo back to the pill and was on this drug for 3 weeks.  With every week, my side effects got worse.  I suffered from extreme depression, anxiety, gained 15lbs, and had horrible cramping (the one thing I was trying to get rid of).  I ended up in the hospital because of the side effects.  I have never had depression or anxiety before in my life!  It went away when I got off the pill.  Four months later, I am still trying to loose the weight!And I work out every day and don't eat sweets!  I would not recommend it for the new user.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Cat, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: KGIRL19681, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: MY PAINS ARE NOT AS BAD

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have recently switched from YAZ to Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo and I love it! Before the YAZ I was on another low dose hormone birth control that I loved but I listened to the advice of my friends and switched to YAZ (BIG MISTAKE and all of my friends soon realized that YAZ was terrible). The YAZ made my face breakout terribly and I had the worst periods, major bleeding for at least 8 days and terrible cramps. Now that I am on ortho I can tell a HUGE difference already and it has been a little less than a month! I hope everything continues to go smoothly. So far so good!!

It has been easy to use, my boobs have gotten bigger, my skin looks great, no spotting ever, no more cramps, and minor mood swings. The only bad part about it is that it increased my appetite and I have been gaining weight!

column2: Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was on ortho for 10 years.  I recently switched to a generic oc and it's been a huge improvement.  Ortho always worked but for years I thought I happened to be an irritable person.  Now I realize alot of that was due to the ortho as I am far less irritable now that I'm on a different brand of daily oc.  I suggest trying alternate brands if the oc you start on isn't working right for you.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had been on ortho tri-cyclen lo for 4 years and was completely satisfied, but I started experiencing break through bleeding, an indication that it was no longer working  effectively. My doctor suggested switching to ortho tri-cyclen because it had a stronger hormone.  BIG MISTAKE, I'm normally a very calm, low key person, this medication turned me into an emotional wreck.  I'd never experienced PMS at all, but I started having severe mood swings and low self esteem, I found my self crying uncontrollably for no reason and flipping out over ridiculously minor things.  I stuck it out for three months before switching to lo-overal, hopefully that works out better.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

I feel tired & bloated all the time.  I am considering a switch to ortho-lo or nothing at all.  These hormones are having negative effects on my body and I feel like I have been on this pill for just too long.
